short_summary: Replacement of floor finish in MTL01
full_summary:
### MTL Workshop Floor Replacement

#### Call for Tender

The National Research Council of Canada (NRC) invites proposals for the replacement of the floor finish in the MTL01 building located at 6100 Avenue Royalmount, Montreal, QC.

**Project Overview:**
The proposed scope of work includes the replacement of the floor finish in the MTL01 building.

**Tender Requirements:**

* Tenders must be submitted by email to [NRC.BidReceiving-ReceptiondesSoumissions.CNRC@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca](mailto:NRC.BidReceiving-ReceptiondesSoumissions.CNRC@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca) bearing the name and address of the tenderer.
* The tender must be endorsed “Tender for (insert title of work as it appears in the drawings and specifications)”.
* The tender package must include the Tender form and Bid Security.

**Mandatory Site Visit:**
A mandatory site visit is scheduled for October 25th or 26th, 2023 at 10:00am. Bidders must attend one of the site visits and sign the Mandatory Site Visit Attendance form prior to leaving the site. Proposals submitted by bidders who do not attend the site visit or fail to sign the form will be deemed non-responsive.

**Tender Closing Date:**
The tender closing date is November 21st, 2023 at 14:00.

**Evaluation Criteria:**
The selection criteria for this tender is based on the lowest price.

**Compliance with Security Requirements:**
All bidding personnel must be security screened to a RELIABILITY status level as defined in the security policy of Canada before work begins.

**Other Requirements:**
All bidders must provide a valid CSST certificate with their Tender or prior to contract award.

**Contact Information:**
For any questions or concerns related to this tender, please contact the Departmental Representative or Contracting Authority:

Martin Legris

[martin.lgris@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca](mailto martin.lgris@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca)

Note:

* Any information received other than from the Departmental Representative or Contracting Authority will be disregarded when awarding the contract and during construction.
* Firms intending to submit tenders should obtain tender documents through the CanadaBuys.gc.ca TMA services provider.
